edu.flash3388.flashlib.robot.systems

Class FlashDrive

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.flash3388.flashlib.robot.System
      • edu.flash3388.flashlib.robot.systems.FlashDrive
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    DriveSystem, ModableMotor, Rotatable, TankDriveSystem, XAxisMovable, YAxisMovable

    public class FlashDrive
extends System
implements TankDriveSystem
    This class offers a wide range of both joystick-based driving solutions and autonomous drives. The instance allows for an unlimited amount of motors on four sides of the robot. The class contains the following drive methods: Tank Drive Arcade Drive Squared Omni Drive The autonomous methods allow for all-direction joystick-free movement.

    • Constructor Detail

      • FlashDrive

        public FlashDrive(FlashSpeedController right,
                  FlashSpeedController left)
        Creates an instance of the FlashDrive class. Allows for an unlimited amount of motors on the sides of the robot (right and left).
        Parameters:
        right - An instance of the Controllers class representing the motor controllers on the right side.
        left - An instance of the Controllers class representing the motor controllers on the left side.

      • FlashDrive

        public FlashDrive(FlashSpeedController right,
                  FlashSpeedController left,
                  FlashSpeedController front,
                  FlashSpeedController back)
        Creates an instance of the FlashDrive class. Allows for an unlimited amount of motors on all sides of the robot (right, left, front and back).
        Parameters:
        right - An instance of the Controllers class representing the motor controllers on the right side.
        left - An instance of the Controllers class representing the motor controllers on the left side.
        front - An instance of the Controllers class representing the motor controllers on the front side.
        back - An instance of the Controllers class representing the motor controllers on the rear side.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If all parameters are null.

    • Method Detail

      • setInverted

        public void setInverted(FlashDrive.MotorSide s,
                        boolean inverted)
        Sets whether all the motors in a side are inverted or not (forward is backward and other wise).
        Parameters:
        s - The position of the motors on the robot as an instance of the MotorSide class.
        inverted - A boolean representing whether the motors are inverted or not.

      • getSpeedLimit

        public double getSpeedLimit()

      • tankDrive

        public void tankDrive(double right,
                      double left)
        Tank drive implements a dual joystick drive. Given right and left speed values, the code sets the values to move each side separately.
        Parameters:
        right - The speed value of the right side of motors 1 to -1.
        left - The speed value of the left side of motors 1 to -1.

      • tankDrive

        public void tankDrive(double right,
                      double left,
                      boolean squared)
        Tank drive implements a dual joystick drive. Given right and left speed values, the code sets the values to move each side separately. Allows to decrease the values of the speeds by choosing to square them. Given a value SPEED when squared is true, the resulting value is SPEED * SPEED.
        Parameters:
        right - The speed value of the right side of motors.
        left - The speed value of the left side of motors.
        squared - If true, the speed will be multiplied by it self for smaller values.

      • tankDrive

        public void tankDrive(Stick stick_right,
                      Stick stick_left)
        Tank drive implements a dual joystick drive. Given right and left joysticks, the code sets the Y axis values to move each side separately.
        Parameters:
        stick_right - The joystick for moving the right side.
        stick_left - The joystick for moving the left side.

      • tankDrive

        public void tankDrive(Stick stick_right,
                      Stick stick_left,
                      boolean squared)
        Tank drive implements a dual joystick drive. Given right and left joysticks, the code sets the Y axis values to move each side separately. Allows to decrease the values of the speeds by choosing to square them. Given a value SPEED when squared is true, the resulting value is SPEED * SPEED.
        Parameters:
        stick_right - The joystick for moving the right side.
        stick_left - The joystick for moving the left side.
        squared - If true, the speed will be multiplied by it self for smaller values.

      • tankDrive

        public void tankDrive(edu.wpi.first.wpilibj.Joystick stick_right,
                      int right_axis,
                      edu.wpi.first.wpilibj.Joystick stick_left,
                      int left_axis)
        Tank drive implements a dual joystick drive. Given right and left joysticks, the code sets the values of a given axis to move each side separately.
        Parameters:
        stick_right - The joystick for moving the right side.
        right_axis - The axis on the right side joystick.
        stick_left - The joystick for moving the left side.
        left_axis - The axis on the left side joystick.

      • tankDrive

        public void tankDrive(edu.wpi.first.wpilibj.Joystick stick_right,
                      int right_axis,
                      edu.wpi.first.wpilibj.Joystick stick_left,
                      int left_axis,
                      boolean squared)
        Tank drive implements a dual joystick drive. Given right and left joysticks, the code sets the values of a given axis to move each side separately. Allows to decrease the values of the speeds by choosing to square them. Given a value SPEED when squared is true, the resulting value is SPEED * SPEED.
        Parameters:
        stick_right - The joystick for moving the right side.
        right_axis - The axis on the right side joystick.
        stick_left - The joystick for moving the left side.
        left_axis - The axis on the left side joystick.
        squared - If true, the speed will be multiplied by it self for smaller values.

      • arcadeDrive

        public void arcadeDrive(double moveValue,
                        double rotateValue)
        Arcade drive implements a single joystick drive. Given move and rotate speed values, the code sets the values to move the robot. The move value is responsible for moving the robot forward and backward while the rotate value is responsible for the robot rotation. When both values are not zero then the value taken is the absolute bigger.
        Parameters:
        moveValue - The value to move forward or backward 1 to -1.
        rotateValue - The value to rotate right or left 1 to -1.

      • arcadeDrive

        public void arcadeDrive(double moveValue,
                        double rotateValue,
                        boolean squared)
        Arcade drive implements a single joystick drive. Given move and rotate speed values, the code sets the values to move each side separately. The move value is responsible for moving the robot forward and backward while the rotate value is responsible for the robot rotation. When both values are not zero then the value taken is the absolute bigger. Allows to decrease the values of the speeds by choosing to square them. Given a value SPEED when squared is true, the resulting value is SPEED * SPEED.
        Parameters:
        moveValue - The value to move forward or backward.
        rotateValue - The value to rotate right or left.
        squared - If true, the speed will be multiplied by it self for smaller values.

      • arcadeDrive

        public void arcadeDrive(Stick stick)
        Arcade drive implements a single joystick drive. Given a joystick, the code sets the values of the Y axis as move value and X axis as the rotate value. The move value is responsible for moving the robot forward and backward while the rotate value is responsible for the robot rotation. When both values are not zero then the value taken is the absolute bigger.
        Parameters:
        stick - The joystick to use for Arcade single stick driving. The Y axis will be selected for forwards and backwards and the X axis will be selected for rotation rate.

      • arcadeDrive

        public void arcadeDrive(Stick stick,
                        boolean squared)
        Arcade drive implements a single joystick drive. Given a joystick, the code sets the values of the Y axis as move value and X axis as the rotate value. The move value is responsible for moving the robot forward and backward while the rotate value is responsible for the robot rotation. When both values are not zero then the value taken is the absolute bigger. Allows to decrease the values of the speeds by choosing to square them. Given a value SPEED when squared is true, the resulting value is SPEED * SPEED.
        Parameters:
        stick - The joystick to use for Arcade single stick driving. The Y axis will be selected for forwards and backwards and the X axis will be selected for rotation rate.
        squared - If true, the speed will be multiplied by it self for smaller values.

      • arcadeDrive

        public void arcadeDrive(edu.wpi.first.wpilibj.Joystick stick,
                        int move_axis,
                        int rotate_axis)
        Arcade drive implements a single joystick drive. Given a joystick, the code sets the values of a given move axis as move value and a given rotate axis as the rotate value. The move value is responsible for moving the robot forward and backward while the rotate value is responsible for the robot rotation. When both values are not zero then the value taken is the absolute bigger.
        Parameters:
        stick - The joystick to use for Arcade single stick driving. The move axis will be selected for forwards and backwards and the rotate axis will be selected for rotation rate.
        move_axis - The axis number on the joystick to be selected for forwards and backwards.
        rotate_axis - The axis number on the joystick to be selected for rotation rate.

      • arcadeDrive

        public void arcadeDrive(edu.wpi.first.wpilibj.Joystick stick,
                        int move_axis,
                        int rotate_axis,
                        boolean squared)
        Arcade drive implements a single joystick drive. Given a joystick, the code sets the values of a given move axis as move value and a given rotate axis as the rotate value. The move value is responsible for moving the robot forward and backward while the rotate value is responsible for the robot rotation. When both values are not zero then the value taken is the absolute bigger. Allows to decrease the values of the speeds by choosing to square them. Given a value SPEED when squared is true, the resulting value is SPEED * SPEED.
        Parameters:
        stick - The joystick to use for Arcade single stick driving. The move axis will be selected for forwards and backwards and the rotate axis will be selected for rotation rate.
        move_axis - The axis number on the joystick to be selected for forwards and backwards.
        rotate_axis - The axis number on the joystick to be selected for rotation rate.
        squared - If true, the speed will be multiplied by it self for smaller values.

      • omniDrive

        public void omniDrive(double y,
                      double x)
        Omni drive implements a single joystick drive where there are wheels on the sides of the robot to move forward and backwards and there are also wheels in the front and back to move right and left without rotating. Given a Y and X value the drive sets the Y value to move the wheels on the sides of the robot(right and left) and the X value to move the wheels in the front and back.
        Parameters:
        y - The speed to move the motors on the side of the robot.
        x - The speed to move the motors on the front and back of the robot.

      • omniDrive

        public void omniDrive(double y,
                      double x,
                      boolean squared)
        Omni drive implements a single joystick drive where there are wheels on the sides of the robot to move forward and backwards and there are also wheels in the front and back to move right and left without rotating. Given a Y and X value the drive sets the Y value to move the wheels on the sides of the robot(right and left) and the X value to move the wheels in the front and back. Allows to decrease the values of the speeds by choosing to square them. Given a value SPEED when squared is true, the resulting value is SPEED * SPEED.
        Parameters:
        y - The speed to move the motors on the side of the robot.
        x - The speed to move the motors on the front and back of the robot.
        squared - If true, the speed will be multiplied by it self for smaller values.

      • omniDrive

        public void omniDrive(Stick stick)
        Omni drive implements a single joystick drive where there are wheels on the sides of the robot to move forward and backwards and there are also wheels in the front and back to move right and left without rotating. Given a joystick the drive sets the Y axis value to move the wheels on the sides of the robot(right and left) and the X axis value to move the wheels in the front and back.
        Parameters:
        stick - The joystick to use for omni single stick driving. The Y axis will be selected for forwards and backwards and the X axis will be selected for right and left.

      • omniDrive

        public void omniDrive(Stick stick,
                      boolean squared)
        Omni drive implements a single joystick drive where there are wheels on the sides of the robot to move forward and backwards and there are also wheels in the front and back to move right and left without rotating. Given a joystick the drive sets the Y axis value to move the wheels on the sides of the robot(right and left) and the X axis value to move the wheels in the front and back. Allows to decrease the values of the speeds by choosing to square them. Given a value SPEED when squared is true, the resulting value is SPEED * SPEED.
        Parameters:
        stick - The joystick to use for omni single stick driving. The Y axis will be selected for forwards and backwards and the X axis will be selected for right and left.
        squared - If true, the speed will be multiplied by it self for smaller values.

      • omniDrive

        public void omniDrive(edu.wpi.first.wpilibj.Joystick stick,
                      int move_axis,
                      int side_axis)
        Omni drive implements a single joystick drive where there are wheels on the sides of the robot to move forward and backwards and there are also wheels in the front and back to move right and left without rotating. Given a joystick the drive sets the move axis value to move the wheels on the sides of the robot(right and left) and the side axis value to move the wheels in the front and back.
        Parameters:
        stick - The joystick to use for omni single stick driving. The move axis will be selected for forwards and backwards and the side axis will be selected for right and left.
        move_axis - The move axis will be selected for forwards and backward.
        side_axis - The side axis will be selected for right and left.

      • omniDrive

        public void omniDrive(edu.wpi.first.wpilibj.Joystick stick,
                      int move_axis,
                      int side_axis,
                      boolean squared)
        Omni drive implements a single joystick drive where there are wheels on the sides of the robot to move forward and backwards and there are also wheels in the front and back to move right and left without rotating. Given a joystick the drive sets the move axis value to move the wheels on the sides of the robot(right and left) and the side axis value to move the wheels in the front and back. Allows to decrease the values of the speeds by choosing to square them. Given a value SPEED when squared is true, the resulting value is SPEED * SPEED.
        Parameters:
        stick - The joystick to use for omni single stick driving. The move axis will be selected for forwards and backwards and the side axis will be selected for right and left.
        move_axis - The move axis will be selected for forwards and backward.
        side_axis - The side axis will be selected for right and left.
        squared - If true, the speed will be multiplied by it self for smaller values.

      • rotate

        public void rotate(double speed,
                   boolean direction)
        Implements a joystick-free rotation movement at a given speed in a given direction. If side motors are defined then they will be used as well.
        Specified by:
        rotate in interface Rotatable
        Parameters:
        speed - The speed in which to rotate, between 0 and 1.
        direction - The direction in which to rotate. 1 for right, -1 for left

      • rotateRight
